text package¶

Submodules¶

text.DataDensifier module¶

class text.DataDensifier.DataDensifier¶

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator

A data structure transformer which converts sparse data to dense data. This process is usually incorporated in this library when doing unsupervised machine learning. This class is built specifically to work inside a sklearn pipeline. Therefore, it uses the default transform, fit, fit_transform method structure.

fit(X, y=None)¶

Placeholder method to conform to the sklearn class structure.

fit_transform(X, y=None)¶

Performs same action as DataDensifier.transform()

transform(X, y=None)¶

Return a dense array if the input array is sparse.

Xarray

Input data

Returns

sparse array

text.Doc2VecModel module¶

text.classification_deployer module¶

text.classification_deployer.classification_deployer(X, y, n_splits, classifiers, search_space, pipeline_steps, scoring, verbose=3)¶

Build classifier evaluator with hyperparameter fine-tuning grid search protocol

To see an example of this method, see examples//text_class_example.py

Xlist

List of documents (str)

ylist

List of labels corresponding with the documents in X

n_splitsint

Integer defining the number of splits in the cross validation split during training

classifiersdict

Dictionary with key as classifier identifier (str) and value as classifier instance following sklearn’s base model convention, checked here: `Scikit learn classifier checker<https://scikit-learn.org/stable/modules/generated/sklearn.base.is_classifier.html>`_.

classifiers = {
    'LinearSVC': LinearSVC(),
    'AdaBoostClassifier': AdaBoostClassifier(),
    'RidgeClassifier': RidgeClassifier()
}

To see this package’s defaults, see supervised_classifier_defs.py or unsupervised_classifier_defs.py

search_spacedict

Dictionary with classifier identifiers, as used in classifiers, mapped to its hyperparameters.

search_space = {
    'LinearSVC': {
    'clf__C': [1e-2,1e-1],
    'clf__max_iter':[800,1000],
    },
    'AdaBoostClassifier': {
    'clf__n_estimators': [50,100],
    'clf__learning_rate':[1.,0.9,0.8],
    'clf__algorithm': ['SAMME.R']
    },
    'RidgeClassifier': {
    'clf__alpha': [0.,1e-3,1.],
    'clf__normalize': [False,True]
    }
}

To see this package’s defaults, see supervised_classifier_defs.py or unsupervised_classifier_defs.py

pipeline_stepslist of tuples

Define embedding and machine learning pipeline. The last tuple must be ('clf', None) so that the output of the pipeline is a prediction. For supervised classifiers using a TFIDF embedding, one could specify

pipeline_steps = [('tfidf', TfidfVectorizer()),
                  ('clf', None)]

For unsupervised clusterers using a TFIDF embedding, one could specify

pipeline_steps = [('tfidf', TfidfVectorizer()),
                  ('to_dense', DataDensifier.DataDensifier()),
                  ('clf', None)]

A densifier is required from some clusters, which fail if sparse data is passed.

scoringsklearn callable scorer

Callable object that returns a scalar score created using sklearn.metrics.make_scorer For supervised classifiers, one could specify

scoring = make_scorer(f1_score, average = 'weighted')

For unsupervised classifiers, one could specify

scoring = make_scorer(homogeneity_score)
verboseint

Verbosity of the print statements

Returns

DataFrame

Summarization of results from all of the classifiers

text.create_stopwords module¶

text.create_stopwords.create_stopwords(lst_langs=['english'], lst_add_words=[], lst_keep_words=[])¶

Assimilate a list of stopwords using both words grabbed from nltk and user-specified words.

lst_langslist

List of strings designating the languages for a nltk.corpus.stopwords.words query. If empty list is passed, no stopwords will be queried from nltk.

lst_add_wordslist

List of words represented as strings to add to stopwords list. If these words are already included in the nltk query, a duplicate will not be added.

lst_keep_wordslist

List of words represented as strings to remove from stopwords list. This is usually used as an assurance to remove specific words conglomerated during the nltk queries.

Returns

List

List of alphabetized stopwords

text.remap_attributes module¶

text.remap_attributes.remap_attributes(df, ATTRIBUTE_COL, remapping_df, REMAPPING_COL_FROM, REMAPPING_COL_TO)¶

Remap the attributes of a dataframe according to the remapping_df

dfpandas dataframe

Dataframe which will be remapped

ATTRIBUTE_COLstr

Name of column in df which will be remapped

remapping_dfpandas dataframe

Holds columns that define the remappings

REMAPPING_COL_FROMstr

Name of column in remapping_df which will contain the original attribute in df

REMAPPING_COL_TOstr

Name of column in remapping_df which will contain the final mapping

Returns

DataFrame

dataframe with remapped columns populated

text.supervised_classifier_defs module¶

text.supervised_classifier_defs.supervised_classifier_defs(setting)¶
Esablish supervised classifier definitions which are non-specific to embeddor,

and therefore, non-specific to the NLP application

n_clustersint,

Number of clusters, which is usually set to the number of classes

Returns

dict

Contains sklearn classifiers instances

dict

Hyperparameter instances for each clusterer

text.text_remove_nondate_nums module¶

text.text_remove_nondate_nums.text_remove_nondate_nums(document, PRINT_INFO=False)¶
Conduct initial text processing steps to prepare the text for date extraction.

This mostly includes regex-based text substitution to remove numerical structures within the text which may be mistaken as a date by the date extractor.

document : str PRINT_INFO : bool

Flag indicating whether to print information about the preprocessing progress

Returns

list

List of processed documents

text.text_remove_numbers_urls module¶

text.unsupervised_classifier_defs module¶

text.unsupervised_classifier_defs.unsupervised_classifier_defs(setting, n_clusters)¶
Esablish supervised classifier definitions which are non-specific to embeddor,

and therefore, non-specific to the NLP application

n_clustersint,

Number of clusters, which is usually set to the number of classes

higher_n_clustersint,

A value higher than the n_clusters, used to provide other specifications for clustering parameters

Returns

dict

Contains sklearn cluster instances

dict

Hyperparameter instances for each clusterer

text.visualize_attribute_connectivity module¶

text.visualize_attribute_connectivity.visualize_attribute_connectivity(df, ATTRIBUTE1_COL, ATTRIBUTE2_COL)¶

Visualize a knowledge graph which shows the frequency of combinations between attributes ATTRIBUTE1_COL and ATTRIBUTE2_COL

dfdataframe

Hold columns containing attributes (i.e. asset, issue, etc.)

ATTRIBUTE1_COLstr

Column name for a attribute

ATTRIBUTE2_COLstr

Column name for a second attribute

Returns

Matplotlib figure instance

text.visualize_document_clusters module¶

text.visualize_document_clusters.visualize_document_clusters(cluster_tokens, min_frequency=20)¶

Visualize most frequent word in a cluster. This helps when visualizing the results of an unsupervised partitioning of documents.

cluster_tokenslist

List of tokenized documents

min_frequencyint

Minimum frequency that a word must have in a cluster for it to be visualized

Returns

Matplotlib figure instance

text.visualize_frequency_plot module¶

text.visualize_frequency_plot.visualize_frequency_plot(words, title='', linewidth=4, *aargs)¶

Visualize the frequency distribution of a set of words

wordslist

List of tokenized words

titlestr

Optional, title of plot

linewidthint

Optional, width of line

*aargs

Optional, other parameters passed to nltk.FreqDist.plot()

Returns

Matplotlib figure instance

text.visualize_ticket_publication_timeseries module¶

text.visualize_ticket_publication_timeseries.visualize_ticket_publication_timeseries(df, LABEL_COLUMN, DATE_COLUMN, figsize=12, 6, cmap_name='brg')¶

Visualize stacked bar chart where x-axis is time and y-axis is count, displaying separate bars for each definition in LABEL_COLUMN

dfdataframe

contains LABEL_COLUMN and DATE_COLUMN

LABEL_COLUMNstr

Column name of the label/attribute

DATE_COLUMNstr

Column name of the date relating to the document

figsizetuple

Optional, figure size

cmap_namestr

Optional, color map name in matplotlib.

Returns

Matplotlib figure instance
